recipe.name: Blini Pancakes
recipe.description: Blini are traditional Russian pancakes made from a yeast-leavened batter, often incorporating buckwheat flour. They are typically served with a variety of toppings, such as sour cream, caviar, or smoked salmon, and are a staple in Russian cuisine, especially during the Maslenitsa festival.
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the buckwheat flour, all-purpose flour, salt, and yeast.
Make a well in the center and pour in the warm milk, whisking until the batter is smooth.
Cover the bowl and let the batter rise until doubled, about 1 hour.
Stir the melted butter and egg yolk into the batter.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg white until stiff but not dry.
Fold the whisked egg white into the batter.
Cover the bowl and let the batter stand for 20 minutes.
Heat butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Drop quarter-sized dollops of batter into the pan, being careful not to overcrowd.
Cook for about 1 minute or until bubbles form, then turn and cook for an additional 30 seconds.
Remove the finished blini onto a plate and cover with a clean kitchen towel to keep warm.
Add more butter to the pan and repeat the frying process with the remaining batter.
Cooking success! Now sit back and enjoy your meal.
